oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - 1958-10-04 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from Grand Ole Opry Show from October 4, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Eddy Arnold (host, performer), Jordanaires (performers), Stonewall Jackson (performer), Tommy Jackson (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), Chet Atkins (performer), and Del Wood (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddy Arnold; Jordanaires; Stonewall Jackson; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins; Del Wood; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- I'm A Good Boy (Eddy Arnold) -- Eddy Arnold talks -- Grant Turner introduces the line up -- Eddy Arnold introduces the Jordanaires -- Ezekiel Saw The Wheel (Jordanaires) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Stonewall Jackson -- Life To Go (Stonewall Jackson) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Goodin (Tommy Jackson) -- Eddy Arnold talks -- Though Your Sins Be As Scarlet (Tommy Jackson) -- Eddy Arnold and Grant Turner talk -- Eddy Arnold introduces Chet Atkins -- Show Me The Way To Go Home (Chet Atkins) -- Eddy Arnold talks and introduces Minnie Pearl -- Minnie Pearl talks -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl and Eddy Arnold) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Stonewall Jackson -- Misery Known As Heartache (Stonewall Jackson) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Del Wood -- Down Yonder (Del Wood) -- Turner and Arnold talk about Arnold's new music -- Till You Come Back Again (Eddy Arnold) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Eddy Arnold) -- [Unidentified] introduces Johnny Cash (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Grand ole opry (Radio program); Turner, Grant; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Jordanaires (Musical group); Jackson, Stonewall (musician); Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet, 1924-2001; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Wood, Del;
